attributes.action: maintain the national concessionary bus passes across the United Kingdom for all people over 60 and disabled people.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
SAVE THE BUS PASS FOR OAP'S

From Wednesday 1st April bus passes issued to the elderly and disabled will no longer be valid on hundreds of services. 

A year ago, ministers trumpeted the Government's generosity in giving 11 million people free travel on all local buses and coaches in England. Now pass holders will once again have to pay on coaches, park-and-ride buses, open-top bus tours and any services intended “primarily for tourism”. 
If the OAP's are not allowed to use these buses then they will have to pay.

As the banks have reduced the interest on savings and the pension is so low this action will isolate many pensioners.  Do you really want to see more OAP's driving cars?
